nodes.body:
### PR summary [2d674e6942](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14125/commits/2d674e6942966eb3d560b34d8062530b3b6bc949)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ add_sub_cancel_right`
`+ le_iff_le_forall_real_gt`
`+ left_distrib_of_nonneg`
`+ right_distrib_of_nonneg`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

> Reduce lines to avoid lint style error

Please can you revert these commits? This is not inviting you to try and compress the existing code as much as possible; it's best to leave the style warning in place, and discuss splitting the file on Zulip.

(probably the resolution here is to ignore the warning for now in nolints)

Thank you @eric-wieser for your help. 

I've done as you asked. [Here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Porting.20TopologicalEntropy.20into.20Mathlib/near/447002335) is the related Zulip message.

:v: pitmonticone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9683370916/job/26718652818)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9683370916/job/26718653064)

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+
Non-negativity is abbreviated `nonneg`, not `nneg`

Unless there's precedent elsewhere, I think the simpler expression should be on the right hand side.

Also, please remove superfluous parentheses

Yes, there are precedents: 
- https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/58c10cb5f7fdbedeb99512536e1079bb59990dcb/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Defs.lean
- https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/58c10cb5f7fdbedeb99512536e1079bb59990dcb/Mathlib/Data/ZMod/Defs.lean
- https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/58c10cb5f7fdbedeb99512536e1079bb59990dcb/Mathlib/NumberTheory/LucasLehmer.lean
- https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/58c10cb5f7fdbedeb99512536e1079bb59990dcb/Mathlib/RingTheory/OreLocalization/Ring.lean
- https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/58c10cb5f7fdbedeb99512536e1079bb59990dcb/Mathlib/SetTheory/Game/Basic.lean

The parentheses in `c * (a + b) = c * a + c * b` don't seem to be superfluous.
Ops, sorry. Your comments are perfectly fine, but they were displayed aside the wrong line on VS Code.
Done. Thanks.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Real/EReal): add theorems
